title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. The person that interviewed me was very nice and friendly. I felt comfortable talking to her. Be yourself and answer the questions like a healthcare worker. Be confident.
Interview Questions: Why did want to work here

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Very professional yet welcoming. I didn't feel intimidated but was well aware that this was a legit interview. This processes helped my overall development as a healthcare professional. Overall, a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Current highest level of education?

title: Front Office Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Bessemer, AL) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Well I had a telephone interview and it went great, my manager and supervisor was please with the feedback they receive from me. They were great listeners cared about my feedback as well.
Interview Questions: Yes and was very pleased with it.

title: OTR-L Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: They have you take multiple personality test before you interview. You go through a few rounds  of interviews with different directors and therapist. They ask questions based on the test you take.
Interview Questions: What made you want to be an OT?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. The staff performing the interview were very kind and professional, and were very easy to talk to.  They asked appropriate questions and responded to questions I had.
Interview Questions: Why Children's over a different hospital

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview -very laid back just to get a feel of your personality 
Interview with director - more about the resume there were really no interview questions that were hard it was the basics
4 hour shift shadow
Interview Questions:
Strengths and weaknesses 
What are you looking for in a job

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email listing several dates to come in for a formal Interview following by 3 hours of shadowing on the unit applied. The interview was a panel interview, with no managers present
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you didn't get along with someone
Tell me about a time you had to handle a difficult patient
Tell me about a time where you showed teamwork

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial interviews were well structured and  did not pose any discrimination concerns. Response time was  only a couple days.  First interview was in person, and follow up was conducted by phone. Orientation to follow upon acceptance.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you displayed ethical decision making in the workplace?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Birmingham, AL) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Took a while to get a call back after the interview but it is the typical hospital work environment.  I had a panel interview and then took a math test.
Interview Questions: What type of animal would you want to be?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: Received an email telling me to complete a judgment assessment. After completing a judgment assessment got a call for an interview. I went to interview only to be told there might be internal candidates that is also qualified to get the job. I wqs told this information right as the interview started.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Patient Registration Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Birmingham, AL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Patient Registration Manager and her Team Lead. The interview lasted about 15-20 minutes. They asked me a few questions such as what do I think I'll be doing in this position, and a few name a time questions. I applied on 3/12, interviewed on 3/15 and got my offer call on 3/16. Waiting on my results from my drug screening and background check to come back and I should hear back about starting training. With any job, you get out what you put in. Excited for this new journey at Children's!!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in Patient Registration?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was positive. The lady I interviewed with was sweet and thorough. She asked the typical questions. Things like name a time you went above and beyond on the job.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went out of your way for a patient.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Thirty minute interview to get to know each other and then one day of shadowing to observe the unit and gain some knowledge about what is done and who works there.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Birmingham, AL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: My interviews were very relaxed and felt more like I was having a conversation than being interrogated and often sidetracked after the question into an brief off-topic but enjoyable discussion; friends who have interview and gotten jobs at COA have felt the same way
Interview Questions:
Many were behavioral related questions such as:

Tell me about a time you faced difficulty & how you responded/dealt with a difficult patient?
What do you like to do in your spare time? 
What is your favorite childhood (or current) movie and why?
Why do you want to work here/what makes you qualified?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Birmingham, AL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back yet professional. I was asked a series of standard interview type questions as well as some that were casual conversation type questions. I was there about an hour. They called the next day and offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult work decision you were once in.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview.  Asked me about a skill that was not described/specified in the ad.   Gave me the impression they were not very thorough in their processes, which is strange for an HR person not be so detailed in their own ad for a position!  I'm sure it's a great place to work, but when HR isn't open in their job descriptions, it makes me a little nervous.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in online recruiting?

title: Medical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama
Interview Descriptions: it went rather fast  the interview process was about 2 weeks  then there was orientation  that was two long days and boring   you work for individual doctors call pts back pull charts assist doc may do light filing sometimes may have to answer phones  the pay was very low but overall good experience
Interview Questions: the interview process was easy to me  i was able to answer all questions asked

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Birmingham, AL)
Interview Descriptions: Just be professional, but if you are not a compassionate person DO NOT APPLY!
Interview Questions: Possible medical questions.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Birmingham, AL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring and interview process is about the same as other places--there is an HR manager (a great person!) who screens you for the job and handles most of the process, then there is the interview with the departmental director and other senior staff (charge nurses, etc.).

The one on one interviews were okay.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. Depends upon the person.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama (Birmingham, AL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I didn't even have to answer any questions.  The manager told me about the unit and asked if I wanted the job. I think they were really short staffed at the time so they didn't care what I knew as long as I could fill a spot which I was perfectly fine with.
Interview Questions: They asked if I wanted the job

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's of Alabama in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a very lengthy process. I applied for several positions before getting a call to interview. It was very structured and specific questions from HR. The interview was only with the unit director and was not very high stress. I got a tour of the unit after the interview, but then it was a long time before I found out I got the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made a mistake, and how you handled it?
